page.title: 16TOURISM IN FILKINS
page.content: The redevelopment recently of the fine 18th century farmyard for use for small industries has attracted visitors from home and abroad. In the Bridal Barn, the Cotswold Woollen Weavers display all the processes which produce their desirable woven articles, and at home, women knit garments for sale in the shop, using wool from traditional Brit- ish breeds. In the Oat Barn a craftsman cuts and carves stone for decoration, while in the Stable is a furniture res- torer. Two men work in the Calf Pens, one with cane and rushes, the other at wood turning. A further building houses the Cross Trees Art Gallery, which fea- tures local artists. In the Bridal Barn also are pieces in porcelain (both sculptural & functional) by an artist living in the village, whose work has been widely recognised.
